parameters.name: builderId
parameters.description: Builder ID specified in the settings of the CMS app.

methods.description: Get all CMS pages by Content Type

parameters.name: builderId
parameters.description: Builder ID specified in the settings of the CMS app.

parameters.name: content-type
parameters.description: Content Type identifier defined in the FastStore project.

parameters.name: versionId
parameters.description: Version ID presented in the URL path of a CMS preview.

parameters.name: releaseId
parameters.description: Release ID presented in the URL path of a CMS preview.

parameters.name: filters[{field}]
parameters.description:
Filter results by a property of the page (e.g., `filters[status]`) or by a nested custom field of the `parameters` object (e.g., `filters[parameters.collection.sort]`).
*Replace {field} with the desired property.*

parameters.name: builderId
parameters.description: Builder ID specified in the settings of the CMS app.

parameters.name: content-type
parameters.description: Content Type ID defined in the FastStore project.

parameters.name: document-id
parameters.description: Document ID presented in the URL path of a CMS preview.

parameters.name: versionId
parameters.description: Version ID presented in the URL path of a CMS preview.

parameters.name: releaseId
parameters.description: Release ID presented in the URL path of a CMS preview.

responses.description: Object containing the data related to a specific page.

apiDescription:
The VTEX Headless CMS is a no-code management system for storefront content. 
That means you can store your content as structured data in a layer decoupled from the frontend and 
use the VTEX Headless CMS to access and deliver your content to your storefront project.

Notice that the VTEX Headless CMS typically works with **FastStore** projects only. In this case, you can use this API
to fetch data using SSR (NextJS and Gatsby v4+) or SSG (NextJS).

**Servers**
- `https://{account}.myvtex.com/`
- `https://{workspace}--{account}.myvtex.com/`

**Server variables**
- `accountName`: Name of your VTEX account.
- `workspace`: Name of your VTEX workspace.
